Calculate the time he measures
time measured =   .........

Calculate the mass of the model including the water in the tank

State and explain how the acceleration will compare to that of the first experiment
Fig. 2.1 shows a model fire engine used by a student to take measurements of motion
The model projects a jet of water forwards. The forcemeter holds the model stationary. It indicates a force of \(0.060 \text{N}\) acting on the model
The forcemeter is now disconnected and the model accelerates to the right at \(0.030 \text{m/s}^2\)
State one similarity and one difference between vector and scalar quantities
similarity
difference
Give an example of each quantity
vector quantity
scalar quantity

The force exerted by each tractor is indicated in the diagram

Write down the magnitude of the resultant force **and** the angle between the resultant force and one of the original forces

Another student is given the same equipment but finds two polystyrene
Fig. 5.2 shows the tiles alongside the cans
State how she could use the tiles to improve the experiment, and explain why this is effective
The two cans are now filled with cold water and placed equal distances from a strong source of infra-red radiation
State and explain which can of water heats up more quickly
Fig. 5.1 shows two identical metal cans, open at the top, used in an experiment on energy. The outside of can A is polished and the outside of can B is painted black
Draw a straight line from each wave to the most appropriate speed on the right
wave speed
